benchmark_details.name: MotionLib
benchmark_details.overview: MotionLib is the first million-level dataset for motion generation, comprising over 1.2 million motion sequences enriched with hierarchical text descriptions, designed to enhance the training of large motion models.
benchmark_details.data_type: motion sequences with hierarchical text annotations

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a large-scale dataset for robust training and testing of motion generation models and to advance the understanding of human motion generation.

data.source: Collected from over 20 million videos from open datasets and online platforms, with over 1.2 million motion sequences and detailed hierarchical annotations.
data.annotation: Automated pseudo-labeling with fine-grained hierarchical text descriptions.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on the quality and alignment of generated motions with input text descriptions.
methodology.interpretation: Higher R-Precision indicates better alignment of generated motions with text prompts; lower FID scores indicate higher realism of generated motions.
methodology.baseline_results: Comparison against state-of-the-art models such as MotionGPT and others.
methodology.validation: Evaluated against several tasks including text-to-motion generation.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: All motion data comes from open-source and online videos with careful review to avoid potential ethical limitations.
